citation.article-title: Taxonomy of marine Pseudomonas species: P. stanieri sp. nov., P. perfectomarina sp. nov., nom. rev.; P. nautica; and P. doudoroffii.

p.s: Description of Pseudomonus stanisri sp. nov.

Pseudomonus stanisri (stan'ier.i M. L. gen. n. stanieri; named after R. Y. Stanier, a Canadian microbiologist who made extensive contributions to general microbiology and, in particular, to Pseudomonas)
Straight rods, 0.6 to 0.8 μm in width and 1.3 to 2.2 μm in length: motile by a single flagellum at one pole (Fig. 1A).
Accumulate poly-β-hydroxybutyrate as an intracellular reserve product.
Utilize 28 to 42 organic compounds including fatty acids, tricarboxylic acid cycle intermediates, alcohols, aromatic compounds, and amino acids.
Do not utilize carbohydrates or produce an extracellular amylase, gelatinase, lipase, or chitinase.
Aromatic compounds, if utilized, are degraded by means of the α-keto acid pathway as indicated by the m-cleavage of diphenolic intermediates (20).
The pattern of regulation of aspartokinase activity resembles that of Pseudomonas rRNA homology group I (1).
The mol% G+C content in the DNA is 55 to 57.
